A customer discovered the body of a man in his 30s around 8 p.m. at the Chick-Fil-A on Oleander Drive, Wilmington Police said in a statement. The identity of the man was not released. The man died of an apparent drug overdose, police said. There were no signs of foul play and incident is under investigation. - Kevin Maurer Man found dead in restaurant restroom, possibly of drug overdose StarNewsOnline.com February 25, 2011 9:57 PM

WILMINGTON | The body of a man was found in the in the restroom of a Wilmington fast food restaurant Friday night, and police said it appeared he had died of a possible drug overdoese.

A customer discovered the body of a man in his 30s around 8 p.m. at the Chick-Fil-A on Oleander Drive, Wilmington Police said in a statement.

The identity of the man was not released.

The man died of an apparent drug overdose, police said. There were no signs of foul play and incident is under investigation.

-Kevin Maurer
